message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The continuous murmur on cardiac exam suggests patent ductus arteriosus (PDA), which is common in premature infants. Indomethacin is used to treat PDA and could have potentially prevented this abnormal finding in the infant. Betamethasone is used to promote fetal lung maturation and prevent respiratory distress syndrome in preterm infants, while folic acid is important for preventing neural tube defects. Prostaglandins are used in neonatal medicine to keep the ductus arteriosus open in the setting of critical congenital heart defects.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The infant is presenting with signs of patent ductus arteriosus (PDA), which can be prevented with indomethacin, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug that inhibits prostaglandin synthesis and helps close the ductus arteriosus. Betamethasone is given to mothers at risk of preterm delivery to promote fetal lung maturation. Folic acid is important for fetal neural tube development. Prostaglandins are important for maintaining the patency of the ductus arteriosus in utero, but in this case, they are causing abnormal shunting of blood and worsening the PDA.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The physical exam findings suggest a diagnosis of patent ductus arteriosus (PDA), which is common in premature infants. Indomethacin is a medication that can be used to close a PDA before it becomes symptomatic. Betamethasone is used to prevent respiratory distress syndrome in premature infants, folic acid is used to prevent neural tube defects, and prostaglandins are used to maintain patency of the ductus arteriosus in some congenital heart defects.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The continuous murmur suggests a patent ductus arteriosus, which can be prevented by administering indomethacin in premature infants. Betamethasone can help with lung maturity in premature infants. Folic acid can prevent neural tube defects. Prostaglandins are used in neonates with ductal-dependent lesions.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The infant's symptoms indicate a patent ductus arteriosus (PDA), which can be prevented by indomethacin. Betamethasone is given to mothers at risk of preterm delivery to prevent respiratory distress syndrome in infants. Folic acid is important during pregnancy for neural tube development. Prostaglandins are used to maintain a PDA for certain conditions.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The continuous murmur on cardiac exam suggests a patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) which could have been prevented by administering indomethacin. Indomethacin can inhibit production of prostaglandins which prevent PDA closure. Betamethasone is given to accelerate fetal lung maturity but would not specifically prevent a PDA. Folic acid is important in preventing neural tube defects, and prostaglandins play a role in maintaining pregnancy and inducing labor.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Based on the symptoms and physical exam findings, the infant may have patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Indomethacin is used to close PDA in preterm infants, which could have prevented this abnormal finding. Betamethasone is used to prevent respiratory distress syndrome in premature infants. Folic acid is used to prevent neural tube defects. Prostaglandins are used to maintain ductal patency in some congenital heart diseases. None of these would have prevented PDA in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The continuous murmur on cardiac exam suggests a patent ductus arteriosus (PDA), which is a common complication in premature infants. Indomethacin is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug that is used to treat PDA in premature infants. Betamethasone is used to stimulate fetal lung maturation and prevent respiratory distress syndrome in preterm infants. Folic acid is used to prevent neural tube defects in the developing fetus. Prostaglandins are used to maintain patent ductus arteriosus in newborns with certain congenital heart defects.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of continuous murmur suggests a patent ductus arteriosus (PDA), and the use of indomethacin has been shown to decrease the incidence of PDA in preterm infants. Betamethasone is used to promote fetal lung maturity, folic acid to prevent certain birth defects, and prostaglandins are used to maintain ductal patency in some congenital heart diseases.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The continuous murmur and positive Babinski sign suggests patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) which could have been prevented with Indomethacin administration. Betamethasone is given for fetal lung maturation, Folic acid for neural tube defects and Prostaglandins are given to keep PDA open in some cases.
